chart.title: Material footprint per capita
chart.subtitle: Material footprint is the quantity of material needed to meet a country's material demand. It is material production, adjusted for trade. The total material footprint is the sum of the material footprint for biomass, fossil fuels, metal ores, and non-metal ores, given in tonnes per year.
